New Year's Eve TV host, pop music icon Dick Clark dies

Dick Clark, 82, the ever-youthful television host and tireless entrepreneur who helped bring rock 'n' roll into the mainstream on "American Bandstand," died of a heart attack, a spokesman said. (AP, 5:11 p.m.)
  • Pictures Clark's life as a television, music personality
  • Post a tribute to Dick Clark  |  More notable deaths

Romney tied with Obama, poll shows

Romney closes gap with Obama in new poll

Mitt Romney has pulled into a tie with the president among registered voters, according to a new CBS News/New York Times poll. (Globe, 2:09 p.m.)
  • 'Likability' a Romney hurdle | Possible GOP VP's | More

Terry Francona to attend Fenway Park celebration

The former Red Sox manager will now be at Friday's ceremonies marking the 100th anniversary of Fenway's first game. (Boston Globe, 5:30 p.m.)
  • Sox balloons may have tickets | Fenway Open House

Officers mourn slain police chief in N.H.

Greenland Police Chief Michael Maloney was killed Thursday in a shootout while he and other officers attempted to execute a search warrant. (Globe, 4:45 p.m.)
  • Video Mass. State Police colonel talks about fallen chief
  • Police warn of scam seeking money for Chief Maloney
  • Pictures 1 officer killed, 4 hurt in N.H. shooting
